abstract.para: Software RAID is a data storage virtualization technology that combines several physical disks into one or more logical units. Depending on the RAID level, RAID provides a balance between reliability, availability, performance and capacity.

topic.para: RAID is a virtual storage resource using multiple storage devices—the array, managed by a controller that links one or more computing devices to this array. The devices are presented to users as logical storage resource.

Software RAID uses disk controller software. Most RAID controllers use the SCSI protocol because it can address a larger number of hard disks in a more effective way than the IDE protocol and is more suitable for parallel processing of commands. There are also some RAID controllers that support IDE or SATA hard disks.
